concept.title: pageURL
concept.shortdesc: The pageURL variable overrides the actual URL of the page.

conbody.p: In rare cases, the URL of the page is not the URL that you would like reported in Analytics.

row.entry: Traffic > Segmentation > Most Popular Pages Paths

p.note: Although Adobe allows pageURL values up to 64k, some browsers impose a size limit on the URL of image requests. To prevent truncation of other data, page URLs longer than 255 bytes are split, with the first 255 bytes appearing in the g= parameter, with the remaining bytes appearing later in the query sting in the -g= query parameter.

section.title: Syntax and Possible Values
section.p: The pageURL variable must be a valid URL, with a valid protocol. The domain will be forced to display in lower-case before being populated in reports, and the query string may be stripped, depending on Analytics settings.
Only URL-compatible characters are allowed as the page URL.

p.note:
It is strongly advised that you contact your Adobe consultant or
ClientCare before using the pageURL variable for custom purposes.
